pull_request.title: Bump @adguard/aglint from 1.0.11 to 2.0.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [@adguard/aglint](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AGLint) from 1.0.11 to 2.0.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @adguard/aglint's changelog.

[2.0.0] - 2023-08-11

Added

  • Basic rule modifiers validation.
  • invalid-modifiers linter rule.

Changed

  • Updated @adguard/agtree to v1.1.1.
Commits
  • 9e3c48d add invalid-modifiers rule. AG-23891
  • b871631 Improve markdowns
  • cf9ba2f update changelog
  • 05cd1cc AG-24344 Integrate markdownlint
  • bc5fb06 Improve imports and exports
  • de5eb59 fix install of swc core optional dependencies
  • 43f265c add test specs. AG-24478
  • 96cf2e0 Update integration docs (#177)
  • 59a7582 Remove converter folder (#176)
  • 95d220d Update packages and small improvements (#175)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=@adguard/aglint&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=1.0.11&new-version=2.0.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body: It was a quick test, so I might be wrong, but it looks like that in the case of `n-tv.de` Firefox just allow all cookies, otherwise if cookies are rejected then embedded Tweet should not load here - `https://www.n-tv.de/politik/Ukraine-Ganze-Familie-bei-Angriff-auf-Cherson-getoetet-article24322805.html` but it's loaded on my end (I have set `cookiebanners.service.mode` to `2` and disabled Tracking protection, because it blocks embedded Tweets).

comment.body:
Could you please test this rule:
```adblock
chip.de###aabhor
```


>The cookiebanners.service.mode is also useful for some pages, for example https://www.n-tv.de/
Compared with AdGuard solution, it only shows the Cookie Pop-up one time shortly, while AdGuard needs to extra seconds to autoclick.

I didn't check what exactly Mozilla does, but as far as I can see, in case of `n-tv.de`, script from AdGuard filters accept/enable only necessary options, it would be probably faster if it would click only on the "Accept all" button.

comment.body:
@AdamWr 

Took me a while, but I think I found the reason, because other Firefox profiles and browser don't show the placeholder anymore.

When you go into `about:config` and search for `cookiebanners.service.mode` , change the value to `2` (restart browser)

![grafik](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/6276915/e1cd4bf8-b470-451a-b5ec-6d3381b77b37)


This option is also for autoclicking Cookie Banners provided by Mozilla, but also in a safe way to not break the page.
The question here is now, in which way it interfere with AdGuard.

The cookiebanners.service.mode is also useful for some pages, for example https://www.n-tv.de/
Compared with AdGuard solution, it only shows the Cookie Pop-up one time shortly, while AdGuard needs to extra seconds to autoclick.

Maybe Mozillas solution might be not perfect.

Maybe you can check again the page with that option.

labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

AdGuard Browser Extension Firefox 1.51.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

www.larousse.fr

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard French filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard Spanish/Portuguese filter, EasyList Italy, Liste AR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track signals

### Add your comment and screenshots

1.  #
2. I noticed one big problem after updating the filters. That annoying pay or consent banner was gone, but the problem was that most of the items on the site, with the exception of the few above, didn't respond when I clicked on them.
Current clickable items:
LANGUE FRANAISE
DICTIONNAIRES BILINGUES
TRADUCTEUR
CONJUGATEUR
ENCYCLOPDIE
CUISINE
FORUM
JEUX
LIVRES
Currently unclickable items: everything except the above.
e.g) Flag and language items in the centre of the website

Also, on the language-specific dictionary site, you can't enter text in an empty text box.
Also when I click the button nothing happens.

e.g) https://www.larousse.fr/dictionnaires/italien-francais
https://www.larousse.fr/dictionnaires/francais-arabe

3. Screenshots
<details><[summary]>Screenshot 1:</summary>
https://imgur.com/VXvlbeT
https://imgur.com/SYEKKYv

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@leonecorn Added `larousse.fr###poool-widget`. Is it enough?
In AdGuards this issue is resolved by click-action scriptlet. uBO does not support it, but setting cookies is may be a short-living solution.

issue.title: Ticket 781518 - Adguard not connected with Browser Assistant
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Mac ### AdGuard version 2.11.0.1293 beta ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers, Annoyances pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.globo.com/ ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List, Legitimate URL Shortener ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Importing settings from my personal laptop to my work laptop is not working. The ticket #781518 was raised. It seems as a bad communication between the app and the Safari assistant. On example 1, we see that the add is blocked, but my user role using the "Element blocking" > globo.com##section.ad-container to block the grey panel is not being blocked. On the second screenshot, not even the ads are being blocked inside Google. Both cases are not happening on Edge using the web browser extension (same laptop). 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
Screenshot 2:

comment.body:
@ryanbr Could you please take a look?
It seems that website is broken by this rule:
```adblock
||accounts.google.com/gsi/client$script,third-party
```
from `Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List`.

Something like this:
```adblock
@@||accounts.google.com/gsi/client$domain=defence24.pl
```
should fixes it.

This button redirects to google lens if the app is already installed. I'm not sure the button should be removed because it could be handy for quick switching between apps. 

Rule for the user rules:
`google.*###main form[action="/search"] a[href^="https://search.app.goo.gl/"]`

labels.name: A: In progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Mac ### AdGuard version 2.11.0.1293 beta ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers, Annoyances pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.globo.com/ ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List, Legitimate URL Shortener ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Importing settings from my personal laptop to my work laptop is not working. The ticket #781518 was raised. It seems as a bad communication between the app and the Safari assistant. On example 1, we see that the add is blocked, but my user role using the "Element blocking" > globo.com##section.ad-container to block the grey panel is not being blocked. On the second screenshot, not even the ads are being blocked inside Google. Both cases are not happening on Edge using the web browser extension (same laptop). 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
Screenshot 2:
### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Fixed? I've updated all the filters now and the exactly same behavior happens on both websites.

issue.title: globo.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Mac ### AdGuard version 2.11.0.1293 beta ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers, Annoyances pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.globo.com/ ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List, Legitimate URL Shortener ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Importing settings from my personal laptop to my work laptop is not working. The ticket #781518 was raised. It seems as a bad communication between the app and the Safari assistant. On example 1, we see that the add is blocked, but my user role using the "Element blocking" > globo.com##section.ad-container to block the grey panel is not being blocked. On the second screenshot, not even the ads are being blocked inside Google. Both cases are not happening on Edge using the web browser extension (same laptop). 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
Screenshot 2:
### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Mac ### AdGuard version 2.11.0.1293 beta ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers, Annoyances pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.globo.com/ ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List, Legitimate URL Shortener ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Importing settings from my personal laptop to my work laptop is not working. The ticket #781518 was raised. It seems as a bad communication between the app and the Safari assistant. On example 1, we see that the add is blocked, but my user role using the "Element blocking" > globo.com##section.ad-container to block the grey panel is not being blocked. On the second screenshot, not even the ads are being blocked inside Google. Both cases are not happening on Edge using the web browser extension (same laptop). 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
Screenshot 2:
### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition
